title: Bojan Mlađović
text:
Bojan Mlađović (; born 16 October 1995) is a <a href="Serbia">Serbia</a>n <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29">defender</a> who plays for <a href="FK%20Metalac%20Gornji%20Milanovac">FK Metalac Gornji Milanovac</a>.
Club career.
Born in <a href="Kosovska%20Mitrovica">Kosovska Mitrovica</a>, Mlađović started playing football in local football club <a href="FK%20Trep%C4%8Da">Trepča</a>, where he also passed youth categories. He moved to <a href="FK%20Sloga%20Kraljevo">Sloga Kraljevo</a> in 2012, playing for two seasons with the club as a youngster. After he overgrown youth selection, Mlađović returned to his home club Trepča for the 2014–15 season, making his first senior appearances in the <a href="Morava%20Zone%20League">Morava Zone League</a>, and <a href="Serbian%20Cup">Serbian Cup</a>. For the next season, Mlađović moved to the <a href="Serbian%20League%20West">Serbian League West</a> side <a href="FK%20Mokra%20Gora">Mokra Gora</a>, but after a half-season, he joined <a href="FK%20Teleoptik">Teleoptik</a>. Playing with Teleoptik, Mlađović collected 16 appearances in the <a href="Serbian%20League%20Belgrade">Serbian League Belgrade</a> at total between 2016 and 2017, making promotion in the <a href="Serbian%20First%20League">Serbian First League</a>. In summer 2017 he left Teleoptik, and signed with <a href="Serbian%20SuperLiga">SuperLiga</a> club <a href="OFK%20Ba%C4%8Dka">Bačka</a>. He made his professional debut for new club against <a href="FK%20Spartak%20Subotica">Spartak Subotica</a> on 22 July 2017. On the last day of the summer transfer window 2017, Mlađović moved to the <a href="Serbian%20First%20League">Serbian First League</a> club <a href="FK%20In%C4%91ija">Inđija</a>.
